############################################################
## 1. Diet Analysis
############################################################

```{r diet analysis}

library(rKIN)

gero_iso<-read.csv("isotope_data.csv")

gero_iso$treat_location <- paste(gero_iso$plot, gero_iso$level, sep = "_")

gero_iso.kinest<-estKIN(
  data = gero_iso,     # your data object
  x = "D13C",         # the x-axis variable (13C)
  y = "D15N",         # the y-axis variable Î´15N)
  group = "treat_location",  # grouping variable (e.g., population, species, treatment)
  levels = c(70),     # percentile(s) of nearest-neighbour distances to use
  scaler = 2          # scaling factor (usually 1 or 2 SDs of isotopic niche width)
)

plotKIN(gero_iso.kinest)


area<-gero_iso.kinest$estObj$ShapeArea %>% data.frame()
group<-gero_iso.kinest$estObj$Group %>% data.frame()
ag<-cbind(area, group)

```
